intro: Hieraciodes caespitosa, commonly known as the tufted rock cress, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine habitats. The plant has a compact, low-growing habit with dense, tufted foliage and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are usually basal, arranged in a rosette, and are covered in fine hairs. Hieraciodes caespitosa is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
